actions.args: {"body": {"name": "Reza DevRel Contributor Report 2024-09-18 - 2024-10-15", "summary": "Following an initial alignment with @gagdiez.near, and as the winner of the AI track on EthGlobal Brussels, I am looking forward to contribute to the AI docs as well as AI derived tooling such as the near-py package, and a multi-agent helper for Near.", "category": "Decentralized DevRel", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "gagdiez.near", "description": "## Timeline\\\\nStart Date: September 18, 2024\\\\nEnd Date: October 15, 2024\\\\n\\\\n## Requested Funding\\\\nHours: 3\\\\nRate: $50/hour\\\\nTotal Amount: $150\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Summary of Activities\\\\n### Contributions\\\\n1h - Exploring OpenAI assistants to create one for Near docs\\\\n1h - Modifying Algolia/DocSearch components in Near docs to use the OpenAI assistant previously created. In retrospect and after digging with Guillermo, it\\\\\\'ll be more complicated than expected as we\\\\\\'ll need to replace some components with our own.\\\\n\\\\n### General / Other\\\\n30min - One-on-One with Guillermo, discussing a multi-agents project (10/10)\\\\n30min - One-on-One with Guillermo (15/10)", "linked_proposals": [204, 181], "receiver_account": "rezarah.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "150", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": [], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 130478697}

{"data": {"devhub.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Decentralized DevRel* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @rezarah.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Reza DevRel Contributor Report 2024-09-18 - 2024-10-15\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nFollowing an initial alignment with @gagdiez.near, and as the winner of the AI track on EthGlobal Brussels, I am looking forward to contribute to the AI docs as well as AI derived tooling such as the near-py package, and a multi-agent helper for Near.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=227)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"proposal": {"id": 227, "snapshot": {"name": "Reza DevRel Contributor Report 2024-09-18 - 2024-10-15", "labels": [], "summary": "Following an initial alignment with @gagdiez.near, and as the winner of the AI track on EthGlobal Brussels, I am looking forward to contribute to the AI docs as well as AI derived tooling such as the near-py package, and a multi-agent helper for Near.", "category": "Decentralized DevRel", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "editor_id": "rezarah.near", "timestamp": "1729083315635169699", "supervisor": "gagdiez.near", "description": "## Timeline\\\\nStart Date: September 18, 2024\\\\nEnd Date: October 15, 2024\\\\n\\\\n## Requested Funding\\\\nHours: 3\\\\nRate: $50/hour\\\\nTotal Amount: $150\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Summary of Activities\\\\n### Contributions\\\\n1h - Exploring OpenAI assistants to create one for Near docs\\\\n1h - Modifying Algolia/DocSearch components in Near docs to use the OpenAI assistant previously created. In retrospect and after digging with Guillermo, it\\\\\\'ll be more complicated than expected as we\\\\\\'ll need to replace some components with our own.\\\\n\\\\n### General / Other\\\\n30min - One-on-One with Guillermo, discussing a multi-agents project (10/10)\\\\n30min - One-on-One with Guillermo (15/10)", "linked_proposals": [204, 181], "receiver_account": "rezarah.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "150", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "rezarah.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"handle": "developer-dao", "community_addon": {"id": "1mcnhy", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"DevDAO Funding Guidelines\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"DevDAO Funding Guidelines\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*Updated October 16, 2024*\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWelcome! If you have a project that improves the NEAR developer experience, DevDAO may be able to provide funding.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## About DevDAO\\\\\\\\nDevDAO is the primary organization behind DevHub. Our mission is to build a thriving, self-sufficient NEAR developer community by focusing on developer onboarding and engagement.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Areas of Funding\\\\\\\\nWe support initiatives that make it easier for developers to get started with NEAR, engage with the community, and contribute successfully. Example areas:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **DevTools**: SDKs, CLIs, IDEs, and documentation (Rust and JS stacks) that streamline development.\\\\\\\\n* **DevRel**: Activities that onboard and engage developers including tutorials, guides, onboarding experiences, community support channels, and IRL/online events.\\\\\\\\n* **DevHub Portal**: Creating essential tools for managing proposals, treasury, and community collaboration.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Evaluation Criteria\\\\\\\\nWe want to fund projects that positively impact the NEAR developer journey. Here\\\\\\'s what we look for:\\\\\\\\n* **Developer First**: We strongly support proposals that prioritize the needs of developers and help growth and retain the number of active developers on NEAR. Show us how your solution will make it easy for developers to succeed, whether through tools, libraries, education, or other initiatives.\\\\\\\\n* **Open Source**: Not all proposals require code, but they should follow the spirit of knowledge sharing and collaboration.\\\\\\\\n* **Public Good**: We want to see clear benefits to the NEAR & broader community.\\\\\\\\n* **Execution Ability**: Demonstrate your ability to to deliver by sharing your team\\\\u{2019}s track record of success and available resources.\\\\\\\\n* **Clear Use of Funds**: We expect to carefully consider the factors that influence your funding amount request and present clearly how the funding will enable your goals.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Proposal Types\\\\\\\\nWe accept two types of proposals: Project Proposals & Regular Contributor Reports.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n### Type 1: Project Proposal\\\\\\\\nProject proposals outline new projects or major milestones within existing projects. They require a detailed explanation of goals, budget, team information, and timeline. The decision making and funding process for such proposals is a collaborative and transparent effort between the applicant, various Work Groups in the NEAR developer community, and the DevDAO Moderators. It involves the key stages below.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 1: Draft\\\\\\\\nThe proposal life cycle begins when an author submits a draft. During the draft stage, the proposal is open for community comments and the author can still make changes and build consensus.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **Get Started**: To submit a draft, navigate to the [/proposals](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposals) feed page and click \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"New Proposal.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" It is a good idea to browse other proposals to learn from previous efforts and consider how your proposal differs from or builds upon existing ideas. \\\\\\\\n* **Fill Out Your Draft**: Complete these required fields:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Category: Select the category that best aligns with your project or contribution.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Title: Craft a concise and descriptive title that captures the essence of your proposal in a few words. This will appear on your proposal\\\\u{2019}s detail page and the main proposal feed. Keep it short, please. (e.g., \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Streamlined Onboarding Tutorials for New NEAR Developers\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Summary: Briefly explain your proposal\\\\\\'s goals and the benefits it brings to the NEAR developer community. (Consider using a problem-solution approach: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Problem: New developers struggle to find clear onboarding resources. Solution: We propose creating interactive tutorials...\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Description: Expand on your summary with details like your contribution timeline, key milestones, team background, and a clear breakdown of how the funds will be used. Keep the description simple and easy to understand. Proposals should be simple and clear (e.g. 1 month). For more complex projects, treat each milestone as a separate proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Other Fields: Complete all other remaining fields, including KYC/KYB Verification, funding amount, currency preference, NEAR wallet address, requested sponsor, and consent to the Terms & Conditions and Code of Conduct.\\\\\\\\n* **Submit or Continue Editing**: Click \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Submit Draft\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" if ready to post the draft to the community, or \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Ready for review\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" if ready to start the official review process with DevDAO. After confirming the transaction, you will see your proposal in draft mode. To edit the proposal, click Edit.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 2: Review\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **Move to Review**: Once you\\\\\\'re ready for DevDAO to review your proposal, change the status to \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Ready for Review.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" This moves your proposal to the review stage and locks the editing function, but comments are still open. After confirming the transaction, you will see your proposal in Review mode. At this point, DevDAO may consider reviewing your proposal. DevHub Community Managers review submitted proposals on a weekly cadence and request from the appropriate Work Groups or DevHub Moderators to review. \\\\\\\\n* **Community Input**: Your proposal is open for discussion. Engage with the community, consider suggestions, and make any necessary adjustments based on feedback. \\\\\\\\n* **Sponsor Review**: DevDAO Moderators review submitted proposals on a regular cadence and may consult relevant working groups for input.\\\\\\\\n* **KYC/KYB Verification**: To get approved and receive funding on DevHub, all users must complete [KYC](https://go.fractal.id/near-social-kyc) or [KYB](https://go.fractal.id/near-social-kyb) verification to ensure legal compliance. DevDAO Moderators must check that the recipient is verified in order to proceed to the decision stage.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nNote: If you wish to cancel your proposal, you can click Cancel Proposal. This changes the status to Canceled, signaling to DevDAO that it\\\\u{2019}s no longer active or relevant.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 3: Decision\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **DevDAO Evaluation** DevDAO Moderators consider community feedback, available budget, alignment with focus areas, and various other factors to make a collaborative decision. Once the DevDAO Moderators update the decision, they will add a comment to the sponsorship to indicate the decision & next steps. \\\\\\\\n* **Possible Decisions**: Approved, Approved (Conditional), Rejected, Canceled (by the author).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 4: Payment Processing\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **Information Collection & Legal Steps (with NEAR Foundation)**: Once verified, DevDAO FinOps moderator will initiate the funding process and request for you to complete the following required steps with the NEAR Foundation:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t1. Submit an invoice after receiving an email from the NEAR Foundation finance team using Request Finance.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t3. Confirm the test transaction after receiving a test transaction confirmation email from the NEAR Foundation finance team. \\\\\\\\n* **Payment Disbursement**: Typically, funds are disbursed within 10 business days, but timelines may vary.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 5: Funded\\\\\\\\n* **Transparency**: Once funded, payment details are made public on the proposal page.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Type 2: Contributor Report\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nContributor Reports outline updates from regular recurring contributors. They also follow a structured process to ensure visibility and timely payments, although they are streamlined compared to project proposals due to the established trust and ongoing collaboration with DevHub. These reports may include completed tasks, hours worked, challenges, deliverables, or other relevant activities (as applicable based on your scope and agreement with DevHub moderators).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Prerequisites\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nBefore submitting contributor reports:\\\\\\\\n* **Align with Moderator**: Clearly define your work scope and agreed-upon hourly rate or payment structure with a DevHub Moderator.\\\\\\\\n* **Create Wallet**: Set up a [NEAR Wallet](https://wiki.near.org/overview/tokenomics/creating-a-near-wallet) to receive your payments.\\\\\\\\n* **Complete Verification**: Complete KYC (for individuals) or KYB (for institutions) verification. Please note that the funding distribution is contingent on successfully passing our KYC/B and paperwork process through Fractal, a trusted third-party identification verification solution. Your verification badge is valid for 365 days and needs renewal upon expiration OR if your personal information changes, such as your name, address, or ID expiration.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 1: Draft\\\\\\\\nSubmit your contribution report on the DevHub portal, providing relevant details based on your scope and agreement with DevHub. For example, developers can include features or tickets they worked on. Community Contributors can highlight events, content, deliverables, or relevant metrics. If applicable, specify hours worked and connect any calls/meetings to relevant outcomes or operations. Not every report may demonstrate immediate, measurable impact, as some work contributes to long-term goals and ongoing operations.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 2: Review\\\\\\\\nDevHub Moderators review reports weekly, ensuring adherence to agreed-upon scope, expectations, and KYC/KYB verification. Moderators may replay with an attestation or feedback and move to a decision.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 3: Decision\\\\\\\\nDevHub Moderators make a decision to approve, reject, or cancel your proposal. Approved proposals move to the payment processing stage.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 4: Payment Processing\\\\\\\\nSee Proposal Journey Stage 4.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 5: Funded\\\\\\\\nSee Proposal Journey Stage 5.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Feedback and Community\\\\\\\\nWe encourage constructive feedback, especially when evaluating project proposals with more complex scope. Key points to remember:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* DevHub Moderators work closely with contributors and establish the necessary context to evaluate the alignment of their work with project/operational goals.\\\\\\\\n* If you have feedback, focus on actions or insights that help improve the proposals rather than nitpicking minor details.\\\\\\\\n* While transparency is essential, DevHub is a small team that operates with a lean and efficient approach. We provide regular updates to offer a comprehensive overview of our initiatives and their impacts.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Need More Help?\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you have further questions, please post a comment on the [DevHub Portal](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devhub-platform&tab=discussions) community.\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Funding"}}

{"data": {"developer-dao.community.devhub.near": {"profile": {"name": "Developer DAO", "tags": {"community": "", "announcements": "", "developer-dao": ""}, "image": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreifg2kou37l4y4hxidkone5wxocctqmj6ygnbpjhyf2raxly7avtze"}, "linktree": {"github": null, "twitter": null, "website": "near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao", "telegram": "NEARDevHub"}, "description": "We brings together individuals & organizations to build a decentralized NEAR developer ecosystem. We provide social structures and tools to empower anyone to contribute to the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nLearn more about our community [on DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao).", "backgroundImage": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreihlecc5n2l2r6pstnvpmmnff7pfyc6iurfpps2peep32cruolgrt4"}}}, "discussions.developer-dao.community.devhub.near": {"profile": {"name": "Developer DAO (Community Discussions)", "tags": {"community": "", "discussions": "", "developer-dao": ""}, "image": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreifg2kou37l4y4hxidkone5wxocctqmj6ygnbpjhyf2raxly7avtze"}, "linktree": {"github": null, "twitter": null, "website": "near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao", "telegram": "NEARDevHub"}, "description": "Empowering a decentralized NEAR developer community\\\\n\\\\nLearn more about our community [on DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao).", "backgroundImage": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreihlecc5n2l2r6pstnvpmmnff7pfyc6iurfpps2peep32cruolgrt4"}}}}}

It involves the key stages below.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 1: Draft\\\\\\\\nThe proposal life cycle begins when an author submits a draft. This will appear on your proposal\\\\u{2019}s detail page and the main proposal feed. Keep it short, please. (e.g., \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Streamlined Onboarding Tutorials for New NEAR Developers\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Summary: Briefly explain your proposal\\\\\\'s goals and the benefits it brings to the NEAR developer community. (Consider using a problem-solution approach: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Problem: New developers struggle to find clear onboarding resources. Solution: We propose creating interactive tutorials...\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Description: Expand on your summary with details like your contribution timeline, key milestones, team background, and a clear breakdown of how the funds will be used. Keep the description simple and easy to understand. Proposals should be simple and clear (e.g. 1 month). For more complex projects, treat each milestone as a separate proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Other Fields: Complete all other remaining fields, including KYC/KYB Verification, funding amount, currency preference, NEAR wallet address, requested sponsor, and consent to the Terms & Conditions and Code of Conduct.\\\\\\\\n* **Submit or Continue Editing**: Click \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Submit Draft\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" if ready to post the draft to the community, or \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Ready for review\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" if ready to start the official review process with DevDAO. After confirming the transaction, you will see your proposal in draft mode. To edit the proposal, click Edit.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 2: Review\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **Move to Review**: Once you\\\\\\'re ready for DevDAO to review your proposal, change the status to \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Ready for Review.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" This moves your proposal to the review stage and locks the editing function, but comments are still open. This changes the status to Canceled, signaling to DevDAO that it\\\\u{2019}s no longer active or relevant.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 3: Decision\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **DevDAO Evaluation** DevDAO Moderators consider community feedback, available budget, alignment with focus areas, and various other factors to make a collaborative decision. Submit an invoice after receiving an email from the NEAR Foundation finance team using Request Finance.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t3. Confirm the test transaction after receiving a test transaction confirmation email from the NEAR Foundation finance team. \\\\\\\\n* **Payment Disbursement**: Typically, funds are disbursed within 10 business days, but timelines may vary.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 5: Funded\\\\\\\\n* **Transparency**: Once funded, payment details are made public on the proposal page.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Type 2: Contributor Report\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nContributor Reports outline updates from regular recurring contributors. Your verification badge is valid for 365 days and needs renewal upon expiration OR if your personal information changes, such as your name, address, or ID expiration.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 1: Draft\\\\\\\\nSubmit your contribution report on the DevHub portal, providing relevant details based on your scope and agreement with DevHub. For example, developers can include features or tickets they worked on. Community Contributors can highlight events, content, deliverables, or relevant metrics. Not every report may demonstrate immediate, measurable impact, as some work contributes to long-term goals and ongoing operations.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 2: Review\\\\\\\\nDevHub Moderators review reports weekly, ensuring adherence to agreed-upon scope, expectations, and KYC/KYB verification. Moderators may replay with an attestation or feedback and move to a decision.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 3: Decision\\\\\\\\nDevHub Moderators make a decision to approve, reject, or cancel your proposal. Approved proposals move to the payment processing stage.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 4: Payment Processing\\\\\\\\nSee Proposal Journey Stage 4.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Stage 5: Funded\\\\\\\\nSee Proposal Journey Stage 5.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Feedback and Community\\\\\\\\nWe encourage constructive feedback, especially when evaluating project proposals with more complex scope. We provide social structures and tools to empower anyone to contribute to the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nLearn more about our community [on DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao).", "backgroundImage": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreihlecc5n2l2r6pstnvpmmnff7pfyc6iurfpps2peep32cruolgrt4"}}}, "discussions.developer-dao.community.devhub.near": {"profile": {"name": "Developer DAO (Community Discussions)", "tags": {"community": "", "discussions": "", "developer-dao": ""}, "image": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreifg2kou37l4y4hxidkone5wxocctqmj6ygnbpjhyf2raxly7avtze"}, "linktree": {"github": null, "twitter": null, "website": "near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao", "telegram": "NEARDevHub"}, "description": "Empowering a decentralized NEAR developer community\\\\n\\\\nLearn more about our community [on DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao).", "backgroundImage": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreihlecc5n2l2r6pstnvpmmnff7pfyc6iurfpps2peep32cruolgrt4"}}}}}

{"body": {"name": "DevHub Developer Contributor report by THOMAS for 09/30/2024 \\\\u{2013}\\\\u{a0}09/11/2024", "summary": "As Devhub contributor I\\\\\\'ve investigated the sputnik dao contract for a possible audit. Also worked on a caching layer to replace the indexer. Web4 improvements for the devhub contract respository and created a rust crate containing our proposal and rfp struct\\\\\\'s to make them shared between repositories.", "category": "DevDAO Platform", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "theori.near", "description": "## Summary of Activities\\\\n\\\\n**Week 1: September 30 \\\\u{2013}\\\\u{a0}October 4**\\\\n\\\\nSeptember 30 - 2 hrs\\\\n- Created a database connection using Diesel ORM for the caching API [948](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/948)\\\\n\\\\nOctober 1 - 6 hours\\\\n- Extracted Devhub Proposal and Rfp struct\\\\\\'s to Devhub shared module [948](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/948)\\\\n- Published the crate on crates.io as [devhub-shared](https://crates.io/crates/devhub-shared).\\\\n\\\\nOctober 2 - 2 hour\\\\n- Standup\\\\n- Worked on the caching API, ran into issues with postgres versions while trying to replace diesel and connect with sqlx instead.
